head.title: A Park to Stir Me, and Soothe You

hedline.hl1: A Park to Stir Me, and Soothe You

block.p: Re ''Central Park Keepers Struggling to Balance Masses With Grasses'' (front page, May 29): Years ago, there was loud, pulsating music at Bethesda Fountain on any given weekend. While at times I found the beat and the sounds enjoyable, at times I found myself wanting to enjoy the lovely, Impressionist-like beauty of the terrace, fountain, trees and lake in quiet solitude and reflection. The persistent music made that impossible.

Re ''Central Park Keepers Struggling to Balance Masses With Grasses'' (front page, May 29): Years ago, there was loud, pulsating music at Bethesda Fountain on any given weekend. While at times I found the beat and the sounds enjoyable, at times I found myself wanting to enjoy the lovely, Impressionist-like beauty of the terrace, fountain, trees and lake in quiet solitude and reflection. The persistent music made that impossible.

Today, many of the musicians are there to make a buck. They know that tourists frequent the spot, and the musicians wait for the bucket to go around when the music stops. The park must accommodate all tastes and styles, and lovers of both noise and peace must allow for concession and compromise.
